com.github.powerlibraries.io.helper

Class CompressorRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.powerlibraries.io.helper.CompressorRegistry

  • public class CompressorRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a central registry which maps common compression extensions to its respective in and ouputstreams. It supports gz and zip extensions and can be easily extended by calling one of the registerWrapper methods.
    Author:
    Manuel Hegner

      • getInstance

        public static CompressorRegistry getInstance()
        Returns:
        the singleton instance of the registry

      • canWrapInput

        public boolean canWrapInput(java.lang.String fileName)
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file or an url or something else that ends with an file extension
        Returns:
        true, if there is any specific InputStreamWrapper known to this class that could wrap the specified file

      • canWrapOutput

        public boolean canWrapOutput(java.lang.String fileName)
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file or an url or something else that ends with an file extension
        Returns:
        true, if there is any specific OutputStreamWrapper known to this class that could wrap the specified file

      • wrap

        public java.io.InputStream wrap(java.lang.String fileName,
                                java.io.InputStream in)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        This method will wrap the provided stream with a decompressing stream if it recognizes the extension of the given file
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file which is used to choose the wrapper
        in - the stream to wrap
        Returns:
        a wrapped stream or the given stream itself
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the wrapper throws an IOException

      • wrap

        public java.io.OutputStream wrap(java.lang.String fileName,
                                 java.io.OutputStream out)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        This method will wrap the provided stream with a decompressing stream if it recognizes the extension of the given file
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file which is used to choose the wrapper
        out - the stream to wrap
        Returns:
        a wrapped stream or the given stream itself
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the wrapper throws an IOException

      • registerWrapper

        public boolean registerWrapper(java.lang.String fileExtension,
                               InputStreamWrapper inWrapper,
                               OutputStreamWrapper outWrapper)
        This method is used to register new wrappers for extensions. Mostly it is enough to provide this method with the constructors of the right class, e.g. 
        registerWrapper("gz", GZIPInputStream::new, GZIPOutputStream::new);
        Parameters:
        fileExtension - the extension that should use the given wrapping streams
        inWrapper - the decompressing InputStream
        outWrapper - the compressing OutputStream
        Returns:
        true, if no other wrapping stream was overwritten

      • registerWrapper

        public InputStreamWrapper registerWrapper(java.lang.String fileExtension,
                                          InputStreamWrapper inWrapper)
        This method is used to register new wrappers for extensions. Mostly it is enough to provide this method with the constructors of the right class, e.g. 
        registerWrapper("gz", GZIPInputStream::new);
        Parameters:
        fileExtension - the extension that should use the given wrapping streams
        inWrapper - the decompressing InputStream
        Returns:
        the wraping stream that was registered for the extension before

      • registerWrapper

        public OutputStreamWrapper registerWrapper(java.lang.String fileExtension,
                                           OutputStreamWrapper outWrapper)
        This method is used to register new wrappers for extensions. Mostly it is enough to provide this method with the constructors of the right class, e.g. 
        registerWrapper("gz", GZIPOutputStream::new);
        Parameters:
        fileExtension - the extension that should use the given wrapping streams
        outWrapper - the compressing OutputStream
        Returns:
        the wraping stream that was registered for the extension before
